snippet: American spy agencies fear that allowing monitor stations in the United States for Russia’s version of GPS could compromise American intelligence.
abstract: Central Intelligence Agency and Pentagon have been quietly waging campaign to stop State Department from allowing Russian space agency Roscosmos to build structures known as monitor stations on United States soil; intelligence officials fear that the structures, which Russia says are for their version of the Global Positioning System, could be used to spy on the US.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn and Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: American spy agencies fear that allowing monitor stations in the United States for Russia’s version of GPS could compromise American intelligence.

headline.main: A Russian GPS Using U.S. Soil Stirs Spy Fears
headline.print_headline: A Russian GPS Using U.S. Soil Stirs Spy Fears
